Guest speakers during the signature  AUPSC events on urbanization, Women Peace and Security were Bineta Diop (Special Envoy of AU Chair on WPC), Maimunah Mohd Sharif (Executive Director, UN Habitat) and Mabingue Ngom (Senior Advisor to Executive Director, UNFPA).

CS Omamo raised for discussions such as: How women in urban settings can become agents of peace and stability in post-conflict rebuilding processes; and how existing organic peace building efforts by local women can be incorporated into peace negotiations and agreements.

Amb Omamo said, women especially those in informal sectors need to be meaningfully included in political decision making, to enable them bring their issues to the peace building table and to create conditions for a gender inclusive sustainable peace.

CS Omamo pointed out issues such as easier access to hospitals, sanitary and hygiene facilities and effective policing, as necessary for increasing security of women and their participation in society.

CS Omamo said urban planning and development ought to be elevated to a national security issue, that should be gender sensitive and taking into account the unique challenges pertinent to women and girls.

Outgoing Head of the European Union (EU) Amb. Simon Mordue, today paid a farewell call on CS for Foreign Affairs Amb. Raychelle Omamo. CS Omamo lauded the envoy’s commitment to strengthen Kenya-EU cooperation and the desire for even closer ties in various sectors of our economy.

CS Omamo wished Amb. Mordue well as he becomes Chief Foreign Policy Advisor to the @EUCouncil President. The envoy expressed gratitude, pointing that Kenya’s strategic leadership role in the region is likely to grow with increasing responsibility on regional & continental issues.

PSs Macharia Kamau, Saitoti Torome and Julius Korir inspected the upgrading of Kitale - Endebess - Suam Rd project. The 45km road from Kitale town, connecting Kenya and Uganda will be of great benefit to the residents of two countries.

5/5 She reiterated the need for global solidarity in climate action, emphasizing that adaptation & mitigation strategies that are more ambitious & gender responsive are urgently required

"As a member of the UNSC Kenya will continue to build global consensus on climate action "

4/5  "Women who are traditionally disadvantaged regarding access to societal decision making power and to economic resources, experience more risks and encumbrances during climate related disasters than men do," - CS Omamo

3/5  She highlighted that “Climate Change is not only an economic, environment and political issue, but also a human rights issue that leads to disruption of enjoyment of human rights with serious adverse effects on women."

2/5  Speaking on the nexus between Climate Change, Human Rights & Women, CS Omamo noted that although the impacts of climate change are severe for all humanity, developing countries particularly in Africa are the most vulnerable despite being the least polluters.

5. CS Raychelle Omamo during the Ministerial @unsc virtual debate said that a key portion of Kenya's effort as a member of the UNSC 2021-22 will be dedicated to moving the #environmental and #ClimateChange agenda forward.

4.CS Omamo urged the #UNSC to strengthen linkages that exists between the Security Council, and regional and continental agencies, such as the @_AfricanUnion to have early warning mechanisms that can provide timely information and analysis to bring transformation  needed @unsc

3. She urged the #UNSC to actively engage on improvement in early warning and predictive systems that will enable Member States to identify and to map #climate change hotspots, in order to procure critical and verifiable data to enable decision making and conflict prevention.

2.#ClimateChange interferes with water resources and worsens food security which causes  intercommunal conflict over scarcity resulting in forced migration and the haphazard urbanization of many areas in Africa.Several nations in Africa are confronting extreme climate events.

1. CS Raychelle Omamo contributing during a Ministerial #UNSC virtual open debate on #Climate and #Security says #ClimateChange has an impact on peace and security, not only as a risk in itself, but as a risk multiplier of conflict, insecurity and State fragility.

CAS @AbabuNamwamba today in Belgrade, Serbia paid respect to the memory of iconic Yugoslav leader Josip Broz Tito at the National Museum's House of Flowers where he and his wife lie in state. Tito was close to Jomo Kenyatta and championed Africa's liberation struggle.
They discussed Kenya-Serbia cooperation on trade and investment in  Big4 Agenda, tourism, security, scholarships and multilateralism.

CS #MonicaJuma met with Ambassador Kwon Yong-Dae of the Republic of Korea to Kenya and reviewed the status of the growing bilateral relations following CS recent mission to Seoul.  She also took opportunity to bid him farewell after the completion of his successful tour of duty.

CS #MonicaJuma bid farewell to H.C Suchitra Durai of India to Kenya. Amb. Durai has contributed to enhancing the cooperation btwn Kenya & India across a range of sectors, she departs Nrb after a fruitful tour of duty. CS wished her well in her next deployment.

CS Amb. Monica Juma held consultations with Mr Manoah Esipisu, High Commissioner Designate of Kenya to the United Kingdom, at her office.  Mr. Esipisu will enhance the already strong bilateral relations between Kenya & the UK.

CS Amb. Monica Juma met with Ms. Hannah Tette, the new D-General of the United Nations Office Nrb. Hon Tetteh takes over from Amb Sahle Worke, who moved to Addis as the UNSG Rep to AU. The CS congratulated her & pledged full support of GoK during her tenure of office

Hon Namwamba commented Amb. Durai for the numerous achievements during her three years tenure as India's High Commissioner to Kenya,and with value adding contribution that has kept relations between Kenya and India vibrant .
CAS Hon. Ababu Namwamba  presents a gift to outgoing Indian High Commissioner to Kenya, H.E Mrs Suchitra  Durai,during a farewell luncheon  in her honour, hosted by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

3/3: CS Juma was with her colleagues CS Public Service Prof Margaret Kobia and CS Defence Rachel Omamo .  In attendance were delegations from Finland, Rwanda, Somalia, Afghanistan, Nepal and UN agencies

2/3: The CS said the two days forum offers an opportunity to celebrate advances made by Government and non-state actors to strengthening women’s equal and full participation in peace and security processes as well as share experiences and learn from one another.
1/3: Cabinet Secretary Amb. Monica Juma delivers her keynote address during the high level peer review meeting on women, peace and security in Nairobi.

PDS @amolosango met with Assistant US Trade Representative for Africa Constance Hamilton & Economic Counselor Mario Fernandez accompanied by the US Ambassador to Kenya Robert Godec to discuss the establishment of the Kenya-US Trade Investment Working Group-(TIWG)

Foreign Affairs C.S  Amb Monica Juma held talks with Nigerian High Commissioner to Kenya Amb. Sheidu Omeiza Momoh who paid a courtesy call on her in her office.
They discussed bilateral issues  between Kenya and Nigeria.

C.S Monica Juma met with U.N special representative for Somalia &Head of UNSOM Nicholas Haysom,and discussed  cooperation between federal Government and member states, and security in Somali,and urged UNSC to provide force enablers and multipliers to facilitate AMISON operations

PDS, Amb. Tom Amolo opened the AU/UNDP workshop on Accelerating the Ratification & Domestication of AU Treaties, at the Panafric hotel,The workshop is supported by Sweden and aims to address challeges and bottlenecks associated with ratification and domestication of AU Treaties

C.S Amb. Monica Juma  bid farewell to the visiting  Namibian President Dr. Hage Geingob who has been on a four day  state visit. He held bilateral talks with his host H.E Uhuru Kenyatta at state house  and oversaw signing of key bilateral agreements between the two Countries.

CS Amb Monica Juma held a meeting with special representatives of the TROIKA member countries (USA,Norway,& UK) to Sudan and South Sudan.They discussed on the revitalized agreement on the conflict in South Sudan..US

PS Amb. Macharia Kamau, received KAA MD Jonny Andersen in his office, accompanied by Abel Gogo, Airport Manager and George G. Kabugi, GM Security Services. The PS commended them for good working relation with the Ministry, and discussed ways of further enhancing that cooperation

CAS Hon. Ababu Namwamba was joined by Amb. Frantisek Dlhopolcek, Slovakian Ambassador to Kenya at Ten Senses macadamia processing factory in Athi River. They discussed ways in which the government can source for funding to  support  macademia farmers to improve their produce.

His Excellency Dr. Hage Geingob arrived in Kenya on a four day state visit and was received at the Jomo Kenyatta International Airport by the Foreign Affairs Cabinet Secretary Amb. Monica Juma,He is accompanied by first lady of Namibia Monica Geingos.

CS Amb. Monica Juma today received Namibian President Dr. Hage Geingob,who is on a state visit to Kenya. Dr. Geingob will hold bilateral talks with President Uhuru Kenyatta and grace Mashujaa Day Celebrations on 20/10/18,in Kakamega. He is accompanied by first lady Monica Geingos

PS Amb. Macharia Kamau today received the Executive Secretary of the Lake Victoria Basin Commission Dr. Ali-Said Matano, accompanied by Patrice Niyongabo.He was briefed on the operations of LVBC, and their participation at the forthcoming Blue Economy Conference in Nairobi-Kenya.

Foreign Affairs CAS, Hon. Ababu Namwamba met Amb. of Algeria to Kenya, H.E. Salah Francis Elhamdi. They discussed bilateral relations between Kenya and Algeria,and postponement of the Kenya-Algeria JCC . Amb. Salah  sought for Kenya’s support  in international forums.

CS Amb. Monica Juma with her Counterpart from Namibia Hon, Netumbo Ndaitwa,when they officiated the closing ceremony of the of the inaugural session of the Kenya-Namibia JCC at the hotel intercontinental,Nairobi.
CS Amb.Monica Juma exchange gifts with her counterpart from Namibia, who is also the Deputy Prime Minister Hon. Netumbo Nandi- Naitwa,when she paid a courtesy call on her in her office.

H.E. Ms. Elin Bergithe Rognlie, Norwegian Ambassador to Kenya paid a courtesy call on Amb. Macharia Kamau at his office. They discussed areas of partnership between the two countries and the upcoming Sustainable Blue Economy Conference scheduled for 26-28 November 2018 in Nairobi

As part of Kenya’s focus on Africa centered foreign policy, Dr. Monica Juma, met 19 African Envoys resident in Seoul, The CS focused on leveraging Africa’s presence in South Korea for optimal outcomes,and underscored

CS. Monica Juma,met PM Lee Nak-yeon, of South Korea as part of a decision reached between President Uhuru and the PM during their bilaterals in Nairobi in July 2018, to continue the high-level visits as a means of unlocking the full potential of Kenya- Korea strategic partnership

Cabinet. Secretary Amb Monica Juma wrapped her official engagements in Japan by visiting the Kenya national woman volleyball team at their hotel at the Narita Airport, Japan,before departing for Soul,South Korea.

CS Amb. Monica Juma arrived in Seoul,Korea for a one day official visit, she is expected to hold talks with PM Lee Nak-Yeon, among other high ranking officials. The CS will seek  South Korea’s participation and support in the Blue Economy Conference, scheduled for November 2018.

The meeting discussed the urgency of expediting the Special Economic Zone in Mombasa, provision of ICT scholarships,opportunities for technical training for young graduates especially girls, investment in renewable energy,funding for universal healthcare & infrastructure projects
CS Amb #MonicaJuma had bilateral talks with Mr. Shinichi Kitaoka , #JICA President on the sidelines of the #TICAD Ministerial Meeting in Tokyo Japan.

CS #MonicaJuma reiterated Kenya’s commitments to implementation of the TICAD VI Nairobi Declaration including winning the war against corruption,investments to adapt to effects of climate change,tapping into the Blue Economy,regional integration & interventions to peace &security

Earlier today, Amb. #MonicaJuma, Cabinet Secretary for Foreign Affairs joined 53 other African Ministers in the opening ceremony of the TICAD Ministerial Meeting that was opened by Hon. Taro Kono, Japan’s Minister for Foreign Affairs in Tokyo, Japan.

In attendance was South African Deputy President David Mabuza, former Presidents Jacob Zuma, Thabo Mbeki and Kgalema Motlanthe among other government officials. CAS Ababu was accompanied by Kenya's High Commissioner to South Africa Amb. Jean Kamau.
President Ramaphosa described her as a woman of fortitude and professionalism who contributed immensely to the advancement of South Africa. The late Molewa was laid to rest at Zandfontein Cemetery.

"On behalf of the Government and People of Kenya and on my own behalf, I join you, President of the Republic of South Africa in extending my deepest condolence to the brotherly people of South Africa, family, colleagues and friends of Molewa."
President Kenyatta in his condolence message conveyed by Hon. Ababu said, "I learnt of the passing of Minister Molewa with a lot of sadness."

CAS @AbabuNamwamba represented President Uhuru Kenyatta at the state funeral of the late South African Minister for Environmental Affairs Dr. Bomo Edna Edith Molewa in Pretoria South Africa. The funeral was graced by President of the Republic of South Africa H.E. Cyril Ramaphosa
The meeting committed to cooperation in multilateral fora on the world expo and election to the non-permanent seat at UN Security Council among other matters.

CS Amb #MonicaJuma had bilateral talks with Hon.Yasuhide Nakayama, Chairman of the Committe on Foreign Relations in Japan’s parliament and discussed ways to remove travel advisories, enhance cooperation in human development, and scalability of small and medium entreprises.
The CS called for an enhanced focus for Japan to sharpen it's engagement in Kenya through investment in human capital development and ICT.#TICAD7 #Jica
The meeting applauded the diversification of Toyota in Kenya to agriculture, healthcare, transport and energy.#TICAD7 #Jica

CS #MonicaJuma met with Mr.Jun Karube, Chairman of Toyota Tsusho and Kenya’s  Honorary Consul in Nagoya. The CS lauded Japan’s durable partnership with Kenya and its recent recommitment through the historic signing of an MOU to support Kenya’s development vision.#TICAD7

CS #MonicaJuma reiterated the need for Japanese businesses to deepen their investment  in ICT, the Big Four, small and micro enterprises. She echoed the consolidating of Africa- Japan trade  to reduce the trade imbalance, whilst enhancing value addition for African exports
Foreign Affairs Cabinet Secretary  Amb #MonicaJuma, participated this morning in a Japan-Africa round table at the sidelines of #TICAD Ministerial meeting.
CS #MonicaJuma, during her visit to Japan will also seek support for Kenya, and encourage participation in the High Level Sustainable Blue Economy Conference to be held on 26-28 November 2018.

During the visit, Amb #MonicaJuma will hold bilateral talks with Hon Taro Kono, her Japanese counterpart, and JICA President Mr.Shinichi Kitaoka, in talks aimed at strengthening bilateral relations and cooperation between Kenya and Japan.

CS Amb. #MonicaJuma is among 54 African countries ministers in Tokyo, Japan to attend the (TICAD) VII Ministerial meeting, that will discuss the implementation of TICAD V -VI actions and prepare for the TICAD VII Summit to be held in Yokohama, Japan, from 28 to 30 August 2019.

The Principal Secretary Amb. Macharia Kamau received the Indian High Commissioner to Kenya, H.E. Suchitra Durai who paid a courtesy call on him. They discussed bilateral issues between  Kenya and India.

CAS Hon @AbabuNamwamba during an interview with John Allan Namu on the ongoing peace process for South Sudan under the IGAD.

Political and Diplomatic Secretary Amb. Tom Amolo and Nigeria High Commissioner to Kenya, H.E Sheidu Omieza Momoh, who paid him a courtesy call earlier. They discussed Kenya-Nigeria relations and how to strengthen cooperation between the two countries.

Key agenda for consideration ahead of the Summit is the Implementation of the follow up actions of  the FOCAC Johannesburg Summit, adaptation of Summit agenda, review and adaptation of the  draft Beijing declaration and  draft Beijing action plan (2019-2021) documents.

Cabinet Secretary #MonicaJuma and Trade CS Peter Munya joined other ministers from  53 African Countries for the Seventh Ministerial Conference of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation(FOCAC) at Diaoyutai Guest House Beijing. The meeting precedes the Summit which starts tomorrow.

Foreign Affairs  C.S  Amb #MonicaJuma  received H.E @UKenyatta and First Lady H.E  Margaret Kenyatta at the Beijing International Airport China. President Uhuru Kenyatta is in China to attend the Forum on China Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) summit.
H.E. the President is leading the Kenyan delegation for the  Forum on China Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) Beijing 2018 Summit expected to be attended by over 50 African Heads of State and Government.
CS Monica Juma when she welcomed H.E. Uhuru Kenyatta and the First Lady H.E. Margret Kenyatta at Beijing Capital International Airport China.

Tomorrow Sunday September 2, 2018, CS Juma will attend the 7th Ministerial Conference of FOCAC that will adopt the agenda for the Summit expected to be attended by over 40 African Heads of State and Government.

The Summit will adopt the next cycle  of FOCAC Action plan 2019-2021 which will focus on following priority areas; capacity building, industrial investment, trade promotion, infrastructure, green and sustainable development and poverty reduction.
CS Juma is in advance team in preparation for  Beijing FOCAC Summit 2018 where by H.E. Uhuru Kenyatta is set to attend on September 3-4, 2018.

CS Monica Juma arrived in Beijing Capital International Airport, China last evening. The CS, accompanied by Chief of Staff Nzioka Waita, was received by Chinese Ambassador to Kenya H.E. Sun Baohong and Kenya Amb to China H.E. Michael Kinyanjui.

C.S #MonicaJuma arrived in Beijing, China and was received at the Beijing International Airport by China Amb. to Kenya H.E Sun Baohong and Amb Michael Kinyanjui. CS is leading advance Kenya team ahead of the FOCAC Summit to be attended by H.E @UKenyatta from 1st to 4th September

C.S #MonicaJuma arrived in Beijing, China and was received at the Beijing International Airport by China Amb. to Kenya H.E Sun Baohong and Kenya Amb to China H.E Michael Kinyanjui. CS is leading the advance Kenya team ahead of FOCAC Summit to be attended by H.E @UKenyatta.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the State Department for Interior have agreed with the Embassy of the Republic of South Sudan on a solution to cause the expeditious release from Police Custody of all identified South Sudan nationals who were found without proper documentation
Hon Justin Muturi, the Speaker of the National Assemby, will lead the Kenyan delegation as the special envoy of President @UKenyatta to the State funeral of the late Dr. Kofi Annan in Accra, Ghana.

Kenya's candidate John Omo was successfully elected as the new Secretary General of the African Telecommunications Union (ATU), for a four-year term. He is the current Director of Legal Services at the Communications Authority of Kenya.

Political and Diplomatic Secretary Amb Tom Amolo held a meeting with the Indian National Defense College delegation attending a course in Kenya. The team was led by Major General Vinaya Chandran together with Colonel Oyunge-Kenya Defense Forces.
President @UKenyatta arrived in Washington DC this evening ahead of his meeting with U.S. President @realDonaldTrump this coming Monday.
CS #MonicaJuma talks to @citizentvkenya ahead of President @UKenyatta and US President @realDonaldTrump meeting at The White House in Washington DC.

CS #MonicaJuma was last evening hosted to dinner by Jendayi Frazer, former US Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs and Rosa Whitaker, President and CEO of The Whitaker Group. The dinner took place at Reston, in Fairfax county, Virginia.

CS #MonicaJuma addressed students & faculty of the Elliott School of International Affairs on Kenya’s foreign policy priorities including the doctrine of peace building. She was welcomed by  Amb. Reuben Brigety II, the dean & Jennifer Cooke, director
Institute of African Affairs

CS Amb #MonicaJuma held fruitful deliberations with Gil Kaplan, the Under Secretary of  Commerce on the Big Four Agenda and US companies interest in Kenya ahead of  the official meeting between President @UKenyatta  and President Donald Trump.
H.E. President @Ukenyatta will be in Washington DC, United States of America for a four-day official visit on the invitation of President @realDonaldTrump
CS #MonicaJuma this afternoon held a roundtable meeting on the South Sudan peace process with scholars at the United States Institute of Peace in Washington DC.

CS #MonicaJuma held talks with Amb Robert Lighthizer US Trade Representative. They discussed US-Kenya trade relations, agreed to optimize on AGOA renewal in the next seven years by supporting the Kenya AGOA Strategy and begin  joint discussions on a post AGOA strategic  framework

Kenya advance team led by CS #MonicaJuma, PS Trade @Kiptoock, Amb Githae and Ruth Kagia in a meeting to put final touches to the Monday meeting between President Trump & President @UKenyatta in Washington DC.

CS #MonicaJuma was last evening hosted to dinner by John Tomaszewski, International Republican Institute's Regional Director for Africa and Elizabeth Lewis, IRI Deputy Regional Director at Joe Seafood, in Washington DC.

CS #MonicaJuma this afternoon met with the Secretary of State @SecPompeo ahead of the meeting between US President @realDonaldTrump and President @UKenyatta scheduled for next week at The White House in Washington DC.

CS #MonicaJuma addressed the American Society of Travel Agents at a reception hosted by Kenya Airways to popularize the launch of the New York- Nairobi route.  She emphasized the meaning of the people-to-people exchanges in redeeming the value of adventure, business and education
The CS  spoke on the role of the AfCFTA in transforming the economic structure of the African economies and their relationship with the rest of the world.

Cabinet Secretary Amb #MonicaJuma addressed the African Group of Ambassadors in Washington DC, USA, on US - Africa relations, underscoring the significance of the AfCFTA  on the post-AGOA cooperation.
CS #MonicaJuma arrived in Washington DC today for an official visit. The CS was received at Washington Dulles International Airport by Amb. Robinson Githae Kenya's Ambassador to USA.

CS #MonicaJuma has conveyed a message of sympathy to the Republic of India following floods that have ravaged the country in the recent past. CS Juma assured the Foreign Minister Shusma Swaraj of Kenya's support during this period.

PS Amb. Macharia Kamau this afternoon received five Kenyan seafarers rescued from Oman after one and half months in the Gulf of Oman where their ship broke down. The sailors thanked the Government for intervention and facilitation back home.

PS Macharia Kamau today officially opened the induction program for newly appointed Ambassadors Designate at a Nairobi Hotel. The PS urged them to tap into their experience, expertise and network to succeed in their ambassadorial responsibility as they pursue the big four agenda.
"We console Kofi Annan's family during this period of loss. I convey condolences to his family and friends."  CS Amb. Monica Juma

Those in attendance at the thanksgiving mass included CSs, PSs, IG @JBoinnet, top rank officials from @kdfinfo, elected & nominated leaders, Members of the Diplomatic Corps & Ministry of Foreign Affairs staff
Friends & family of CS #MonicaJuma together with the community of Nuu gathered today at Nuu Secondary School in Kitui County for a Thanksgiving mass presided over by Archibishop Antony Muheria.

Political and Diplomatic Secretary Amb. Tom Amolo (in African attire) when he hosted a farewell luncheon in honor of outgoing Ambassador of The Republic of The Sudan H.E Elsadig Abdalla Elias Diab at the Intercontinental hotel.

Cabinet Secretary Amb #MonicaJuma held talks with H.E Sun Baohong, Ambassador of the People's Republic of China. In their meeting, they discussed the preparation of the forthcoming FOCAC Summit.

CS #MonicaJuma met and held talks with H.E Yusuf Bin Alawi Bin Abdullah, Foreign Minister of the Sultanate of Oman. They discussed Kenya's candidature for the Non-Permanent seat of the UNSC 2021-22, the upcoming #BlueEconomy2018 conference & best practices of Oman in Oil and Gas

Cabinet Secretary Amb #MonicaJuma briefing the Diplomatic Corps meeting on 14th August on recent important diplomatic developments including, bilateral relations and cooperation, High level visits inbound and outbound, and the status of the South Sudan peace process.

Political and Diplomatic Secretary, Amb.Tom Amolo with Brazilian Ambassador to Kenya Mr. Fernando E. Lins De S. Coimbra who paid him a courtesy call earlier today. They discussed cultural support and cooperation between Kenya and Brazil.

Foreign Affairs Cabinet Secretary Amb #MonicaJuma with Norway’s Special Envoy to South Sudan, Erling Skojonsberg who paid her a courtesy call in her office. They discussed the progress of the ongoing South Sudan Peace process.

CS #MonicaJuma while in Angola, delivering a lecture at Dr. Antonio Agustinho Neto University entitled “Claiming the Future of Africa'.

CS Amb #MonicaJuma expressed her gratitude to her counterpart Hon. Manuel Augusto Domingos, for the hospitality accorded to her by the Government and the people of Angola, added that the visit accords the two countries excellent opportunity to deepen existing bilateral relations.

Political and Diplomatic Secretary Amb Tom Amolo this afternoon held talks with H.E. Vincent O'Neill, Ireland's ambassador to Kenya. He was accompanied by Teresa Sweeney. Ireland is seeking Kenya's support for its candidature for the non-permanent seat at the UNSC for 2021-2022.

CS #MonicaJuma last evening hosted the African Group of Ambassadors in Luanda to a reception. She underscored the role of #AfCFTA in delivering Agenda 2063 & urged them to play a key role in placing the African Agenda at the core of their work so as to secure continent's future.

CS Amb #MonicaJuma is in Luanda, Angola for a two- day official visit. She was received by H.E. Domingos Vierra Lopes, Secretary of State and Kenya’s Amb to Angola Josphat Maikara. She will deliver a special message from H.E. @UKenyatta to H.E. João Lourenço, President of Angola

In the tributes family, friends and colleagues eulogized the late Rosemary as an extraordinary wife and mother; kind, humble and hardworking, dedicated to her work and service to the Nation. Her career as a diplomat will greatly be missed.

Ms Chilese Kapwepwe of Zambia is the new Secretary General of COMESA. She takes over from Sindiso Ngwenya who has retired after expiry of his term. They were sworn in during the 20th COMESA  Summit of Heads of State and Government taking plance in Lusaka, Zambia.

3 Kenyans were today sworn in to take up various posts at the COMESA: Amb Dr Kipyego Cheluget, Assistant Secretary General (Programs), Hon. Danson  Mungatana, Commissioner in the COMESA Competition Authority and Prof. Judith Bahemuka, member of COMESA committee of elders.

During the visit, CS #MonicaJuma took the opportunity to invite H.E. Mahmoud Ali YOUSOUF to the Blue Economy Conference meeting which will be held in Kenya from November 26-28, 2018.
At the regional level, the two leaders agreed to continue cooperating within the framework of IGAD and AMISOM to enhance regional Peace and Security in Somalia and South Sudan.

Cooperation target among other areas education, tourism, agriculture and livestock, trade and investment. In trade and investments, the two leaders agreed to explore opportunities between the two countries that could increase trade volumes as well as flow of investments.

At bilateral level, the two Ministers committed rejuvenate the Kenya – Djibouti Joint Commission for Co-operations (JCC). They also agreed to come up with instruments of cooperation in the immediate, medium term and long plan.

The meeting was part of the regional tour aimed at strengthening bilateral ties with neighbouring countries. The two Ministers held lengthy talks that dwelt on a wide range of issues, at bilateral, regional global cooperation.

CS #MonicaJuma: We commend and celebrate the great work and efforts of Royal Foundation: United for Wildlife, led by Prince William, for working closely with Kenya to create a global movement for change in the field of wildlife conservation.

CS #MonicaJuma: Kenya recognises that poaching and illicit wildlife trafficking are forms of transnational organised crimes. We welcome efforts by conservationists that supplement what government is doing.
CS #MonicaJuma: IWT is one of the fastest growing illicit trades worldwide. The clandestine character of this vicious trade is worth up to an estimated USD 20 Billion annually.
CS #MonicaJuma: The event was convened by UK Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson to exchange views on the issue pertinent to Kenya. Kenya hosts most diverse natural treasures in trust for humanity.

We are happy to note the strong Greek community presence in Kenya, particularly through the Greek Orthodox Church, which under the leadership of His Eminence Metropolitan Makarios has expanded to include 300 parishes actively involved in missionary work throughout Kenya.

Kenya’s position in East and Central Africa makes it an ideal launch pad to access the markets of East and Central Africa with over 150 million people & the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa with over 430m people & indeed the wider African Continental Free Trade Area.

Not only will the AfCTA spur intra-African trade and stimulate competitiveness of African industry, it will also create positive multiplier effects for companies from Greece and elsewhere that choose to invest in Africa due to the liberalization of our markets.
It would be remiss of me not to mention the historic signing last week of the African Continental Free Trade Area treaty by 44 African states.
In relation to Healthcare, the Government is committed to ensuring access to quality and affordable medical cover to all Kenyans by 2022.
On Food Security and Nutrition, the Government is keen to encourage and facilitate large-scale commercial agriculture to diversify food staples through irrigation and other technologies.
In Housing, His Excellency the President’s vision is to up-scale homeownership to more than 500,000 Kenyans.

In the manufacturing sector, the Government’s focus is on value addition to enhance our competitiveness and fingered four key subsectors, namely the Blue Economy, Agro-Processing, Leather and Textiles.
President Uhuru Kenyatta’s second term Big Four agenda offers a roadmap the Government’s priorities and a potential reference point to guide future cooperation between Kenya and Greece.

The Hellenic–Kenyan Chamber of Industry, Commerce, Development, Tourism & Culture, established in 2014, is a platform through which relationships between business entities in Kenya and Greece can be cultivated and elevated further.
The full potential of our economic cooperation remains untapped, with immense potential for enhanced engagement in the energy, construction, infrastructure and tourism sectors.

Greece is an important trade and investment partner for Kenya, with over 40 Greek companies active in Kenya. The total volume of trade between the two countries stood at 1.3 billion shillings in 2016, an increase of 124% compared to 2010.
Since then our partnership has continued to blossom as exemplified by the high level exchange of visits in the recent past.

CS Juma: Kenya is committed to strengthening relations with Cuba and expanding areas of cooperation for mutual benefit.

@AbabuNamwamba: I applaud the great value Kenya's economy draws from our Diaspora spread across the globe. In 2017 alone, Kenyans abroad sent back home a record Sh197.1b. This is a live illustration of how beneficial the free flow of human capital can be to our domestic economies

By facilitating the free flow of people, goods&services, the net effect in terms of economic transformation will play big role in averting resource-based conflict due to attendant economic growth. It will also facilitate an unfettered flow of capital for growth&shared prosperity

The ultimate realisation of Africa’s full potential is dependent on the easing of movement of goods, services and human capital across the entire length and breadth of the continent. Indeed it is an important prerequisite for peace and stability to prevail.

It is imperative that Partner States do remain alive to this fact and double their efforts towards better cross-border management. This Protocol affords us the opportunity to leverage on each other’s’ strengths, hence the great need to work together towards its success.

...to constrict the free movement of people especially resulting from conflict or related human activities. I am, nonetheless, similarly cognizant of the fact that open boundaries and unfettered access to our various countries does present security challenges if not well managed.

This calls for corresponding obligations by the international community of sharing the burden and strains associated with involuntary movement of people. It is neither tenable nor justifiable for a few countries to shoulder the burden while others undertake or devise measures...

Hon @AbabuNamwamba: I wish to note that migration of people has played a crucial role in creating cohesion and bridging cultural misunderstanding. We are also aware of the involuntary movement of people, particularly occasioned by conflict and other human activities.

Hon @AbabuNamwamba: Harnessing our resources both human and economic through better integration will also certainly place us in a much stronger position to better confront the challenges and shortcomings facing our region.

It is also my belief that a better-integrated region will reap the full benefits of peaceful coexistence as well as inculcate and accord prominence to the issues which bind us as opposed to our differences.

...way in facilitating rapid growth in intra-Africa trade. This initiative, coupled with robust regional mechanisms such as what we have accomplished here in the last few days, will escalate our efforts towards the realisation of a borderless Africa.

...and lack of requisite trade facilitation due to unfavourable trading regimes, which generally undermines integration of the African Continent.

@AbabuNamwamba: I must admit, however, that it is disheartening to note that intra-Africa trade contributes a meagre 18% of the total trade value on our entire Continent. This scenario emanates from a multiplicity of factors, including non-tariff barriers...
Hon @AbabuNamwamba: But of course, opening the doors must be done in consonance with the rule of law so as to protect our citizens against human trafficking and related organized criminal activities.

@AbabuNamwamba: Intra-Africa trade is predicated on the free movement of people, goods, services and capital. It is in this context that President Uhuru Kenyatta decreed that Kenya opens doors to Africa as part of deliberate efforts to boost intra-Africa trade and investment.

Governments are obligated under the international protocols to ensure free movement of people, goods & services. Indeed in today’s globalised world, free movement of people, capital, goods &services is a critical component in facilitating investments & attracting skilled manpower
Hon @AbabuNamwamba: I trust that submissions by Kenyan delegation are in sync with proposals from the other four IGAD Member States where stakeholders’ consultations have concluded.

Hon @AbabuNamwamba: I have no doubt submissions here have greatly enriched provisions of the draft protocol, and by extension addressed the perceived bottlenecks that would otherwise have been a hindrance to its effective implementation.

The Agreement sets up an EPA Council that will address implementation issues. It will be reviewed every five years./13
Agreement has inbuilt safeguards on various sensitive products, for example it excludes from liberalisation various agric products./12
The remainder will be progressively liberalised within 15 years from the moment the EPA enters into force./11
Through the Agreement the EAC has committed to liberalise the equivalent of 82.6% of imports from the EU by value./10
It guarantees that the EU will not apply export subsidies on products destined for the EAC market./9
It also creates new regional opportunities through more flexible rules of origin and cumulation framework./8
The agreement provides duty- and quota-free access for Kenyan and EAC products to the EU market./7
The agreement covers trade in goods and development cooperation. It also contains chapters on agriculture, fisheries and economic dev./6
Negotiations of the EAC-EU EPA were concluded by both sides and the text initialled on October 14, 2014. /5
This governs the EU preferential market access regime for African, Caribbean and Pacific countries that have negotiated EPAs with EU./4
With the ratification of the Agreement, Kenya will continue to benefit from EC Market Access Regulation No 1528/2007./3
Handing over ceremony was witnessed by Mme Alda Silveira Reis, Director of Trade, Devel’nt, Horizontal Issues & Foreign Affairs Council./2
Kenya through its Mission to the EU in Brussels yesterday deposited the instruments of ratification of the EAC-EU Partnership Agreement./1
